doc:
A is a container that organizes child widgets into a single column.

Use the packing interface to determine the arrangement, spacing, height, and alignment of children.

All children are allocated the same width.

GtkVBox has been deprecated. You can use instead, which is a very quick and easy change. If you have derived your own classes from GtkVBox, you can simply change the inheritance to derive directly from , and set the property to .vertical in your instance init function, with a call like: |[<!-- language="C" --> gtk_orientable_set_orientation (GTK_ORIENTABLE (object), GTK_ORIENTATION_VERTICAL); ]| If you don’t need first-child or last-child styling and want your code to be future-proof, the recommendation is to switch to instead of nested boxes. For more information about migrating to , see [Migrating from other containers to GtkGrid][gtk-migrating-GtkGrid].
name: VBox
